summary.p: 20 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 6; Qurʾānic Text: Q 31:22-39:15; 18 lines per page; Dimensions: 222/225 x 213/217mm; Script style: kūfī B.Ib.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 6
20 fol. 213/217×222/225 mm (1.0666). Support: parchment, changing from thin to thick, rigid, transparnt, of yellowish colour. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation: two quires.
I: H1F H2F H3F H4F H5F / F6H F7H F8H F9H F10H (fol. 1 and 10, previously a bifolium are now detached from each other);
II: H11F H12F H13F H14F S H15F / F16H S F17H F18H F19H F20H.
Text layout: 18 lines, 163×171 mm (1.0666). Ruling: absent. Script: B Ib. Diacritics: diagonal dashes in the ink of the main text. Vocalization: dots in red ink; is much rarer than diacritics.

Verse markers: individual verses – 3 to 5 diagonal dashes (types 1.1.1, 1.1.4 and 1.1.5), in the same ink as the main text; between groups of 10 verses – two or more concentric circles inscribed in each other (type 1.A.I) in brown and red ink.
Surah titles are inscribed in smaller hand, red ink:
Surah 32 – فاتحه سوره الم السجده وهي تسع وعشرون ايه (f. 1v);
Surah 33 – فاتحه سوره الاحزاب وهي ثلث وسبعين ايه (f. 2v);
Surah 34 – فاتحه سوره سبا وهي أربع وخمسين ايه (f. 7r);
Surah 35 – فاتحه سوره المليكه وهي خمس واربعين ايه (f. 10r);
Surah 36 – فاتحه سوره يس وهي اثنان وثمانون ايه (л. 12v);
Surah 37 – فاتحه سوره الصافات وهي مائه ووحد (!) وثمانون ايه (f. 14v);
Surah 38 – فاتحه سوره ص وهي ست وثمانون ايه (f. 17v);
Surah 39 – فاتحه سوره الزمر وهي ثلث وسبعون ايه (f. 20r).

Dividing marks for rub‘, sub‘ and ‘ushr are inscribed on the margins with black ink and are obviously of a later date: اخر العشر السابع (fol. 4v); اخر السبع الـ[...] (fol. 8r); اخر الربع الثالث (fol. 17r).
Inscriptions: in the upper margin “Roman” numbers of surahs are inscribed in pencil.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures. On the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (leather?).
Defects: stains (especially on fol. 1, 5–6) and traces of moisture, parchment in the upper left corner is damaged, ink has peeled off in some places.
Old conservation: upper margins are trimmed on the left side, some words are overwritten or corrected in black ink.
Old accession numbers: A. 6 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Attached materials: f. I is a paper leaf with the description of the manuscript in French, brown ink; on the verso side there is a fragment of an article, also in French.
Contents:
Fol. 1r–1v. Surah 31, verses 21(22) – 34(34)*. Incipit: [بالعُرْوَ]ةِ الوثقى.
Fol. 1v–2v. Surah 32
Fol. 2v–7r. Surah 33
Fol. 7r–10r. Surah 34
Fol. 10r–12v. Surah 35
Fol. 12v–14v. Surah 36
Fol. 14v–17v. Surah 37
Fol. 17v–20r. Surah 38
Fol. 20r–20v. Surah 39, verses 1(1) – 17(15). Eplicit: أنفسَهم وأ[هليهم يوم القيامة] ."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
